logic

Class DataManager

  • Object
    • logic.DataManager

  • public class DataManager
extends Object
    This is the class that will manage all the data of the game that needs to be shared between the Game instance, and the Narrator class. It was created so that you would not have to set up as many parameters when creating your own methods in the project code.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataManager()

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataManager

        public DataManager()

    • Method Detail

      • createPlayer

        public static Player createPlayer(int choice)
        This will create an instance of the subclass type of player for the user to control.
        Parameters:
        choice - Which kind of person the user chose to play as.
        Returns:
        An instance of the subclass type of player chosen.

      • createMonsters

        public static void createMonsters(ArrayList<Monster> monsters,
                                  int num)
        A monster factory. Could create any number of any type of monsters you design. Either design this code to be random, or set things up in your own way.
        Parameters:
        monsters - A collection to store the monsters inside, so we can use them later in Game.
        num - The number of monsters to create and add to the monsters collection.

      • describeMonsters

        public static String[] describeMonsters()
        This is meant to be used by the Narrator to get a description of all the montsers currently inside the monsters collection.
        Returns:
        An array of strings that describes the monsters stored in a collection.

      • setMonsters

        public static void setMonsters(ArrayList<Monster> monsters)
        This is meant to be used by the Game class to set a pointer to a shared montsers collection. It is faster to just share a memory address rather than copy everything inside the collection. You need to call this in Game if you change the monsters collection to a new collection later.
        Parameters:
        monsters - A collection to store the monsters inside, so we can use them later in Game.

      • getMonsters

        public static ArrayList<Monster> getMonsters()
        This is meant to be used by the Game class to get a pointer to the montsers collection in case we need it. It is faster to just share a memory address rather than copy everything inside the collection.
        Returns:
        A pointer to the collection of montsers.

      • setUserName

        public static void setUserName(String userName)
        Store the name the user entered at the beginning of the game.
        Parameters:
        userName - The name the user entered.

      • getUserName

        public static String getUserName()
        This is meant to be used by the Narrator, so they can welcome the user. You could imagine other reasons to call this method.
        Returns:
        The string name the user entered.

      • isPlayerChosen

        public static boolean isPlayerChosen()
        This is meant to be used by the tell() method of Narrator to avoid a NullPointerException near the beginning of the game.
        Returns:
        A boolean value for whether the private Player is set to an instance (true).

      • setPlayer

        public static void setPlayer(Player plyr)
        Used by Game class to share the player instance with Narrator.
        Parameters:
        plyr - Meant to be the instance the user chose that was created earlier.

      • isPlayerDead

        public static boolean isPlayerDead()
        This is meant to be used by the Narrator to check whether to skip to the end of the story.
        Returns:
        The value true means the player has no hit points left and so the game should skip to the end.
